intro: Sondera erythrogyne, commonly known as the red-stemmed sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with three stamens and a single pistil. Sondera erythrogyne plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
